hsrt.mec.controldeveloper.core.com

Class ComHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • hsrt.mec.controldeveloper.core.com.ComHandler

  • public class ComHandler
extends Object
    ComHandler handles the communication with an object of Rover. The class takes a vector of ICommand objects, prepares its content internally, and sends the prepared commands to the previously specified rover.

    Using ComHandler requires the following steps:

    1. Getting an object of class ComHandler
    ComHandler is implemented as a singleton. An object of this class can be acquired using the method getInstance()

    2. Defining a communication port
    The communication port is an implementation of the class Rover Rover and is provided to the ComHandler instance using the start(Vector, Rover) method. In case the commands shall be simulated the Rover parameter of the start()-Method can be null.

    3. Registering to ComHandler
    The registration to the ComHandler is based on the IComListener interface. In order to retrieve information (here: which command is actually executed) from the actually process, ComHandler implements an event model (cp. JButton and ActionListener). This means, the class which uses the ComHandler has to register itself to the ComHandler before starting the control process execution. Therefore, the class has to implement the IComListener interface and calls the method register(IComListener). After starting the execution process ComHandler will inform the class calling the method IComListener.commandPerformed(ICommand,int) of the interface {link hsrt.mec.controldeveloper.core.com.IComListener}. When calling this method ComHandler provides the actual executed command in form of an ICommand object.

    4. Starting and stopping the execution process
    For starting and stopping the execution of the command process ComHandler provides the methods start(Vector, Rover) and stop().
    See Also:
    RoverHandler, Rover, IComListener, ICommand

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CONNECTION_ERROR
      Ease-of-use constant in case of an connection error.
      static int ROVER_FINISH_ICOMMAND
      Ease-of-use constant in case the execution of a command has been finished.
      static int ROVER_IS_USED
      Ease-of-use constant in case of rover is alredy in use.
      static int ROVER_NOT_SELECTED
      Ease-of-use constant in case a rover is not selected.
      static int ROVER_RECEIVE_ICOMMAND
      Ease-of-use constant in case the rover has received a new command.
      static int ROVER_RUNNING_ICOMMAND
      Ease-of-use constant in case a command is actually executed.
      static int SEND_ICOMMAND
      Ease-of-use constant in case a command is send from the application to the rover.

      • start

        public boolean start(Vector<ICommand> commandList,
            Rover rover)
        Starts the control process based on the given commmand list and the communication port.
        Parameters:
        commandList - List of ICommand objects.
        rover - Communication port of type Rover. If rover is null than the commandList is simulated.
        Returns:
        true, if no error occured; false, otherwise.

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        Stops the control process.
        Returns:
        true, if no error occured; false, otherwise.
